Key Match Events: Michael Jones hit a breathtaking six from the Durham right-hander, the ball soaring on to the roof of the Greenidge and Haynes Stand and smashing a solar panel
Jos Buttlerâ€™s men would have needed 109 from 10 overs to win; a challenging but not impossible target given their array of power-hitters
Pre-Game Insights: England will need to be far sharper against Australia on Saturday than was witnessed here
Matthew Mott said that, with 10 wickets in hand, the ball increasingly slippery in the wet, they would still have fancied the chase
Post-Match Reflections: Richie Berrington said that Scotland certainly gave themselves a chance
Matthew Mott said that England were a bit sloppy in the field, with a bit of nerves at the start of the tournament
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was abandoned due to rain, with Scotland reaching 90 for no loss and England needing 109 from 10 overs to win
The match was delayed due to water leaking through the covers and on to the pitch
Others: Scotland will now face Namibia here on Thursday
The T20 World Cup 2024 is underway
